meanings.definition: Of or relating to a bridge or bridges.
meanings.sent1: The pontic design on the model bridge was very sturdy.
meanings.sent2: The engineer discussed the pontic features of the new bridge.
meanings.sent3: The pontic bridge in the park looked like a mini version of the Golden Gate.
meanings.sent4: Her friendship acted as a pontic connection between the two groups.
meanings.sent5: The pontic arch of the bridge stood out against the blue sky.

meanings.definition: A false tooth used to replace a missing tooth in a dental bridge.
meanings.sent1: The dentist carefully placed the pontic in the dental bridge.
meanings.sent2: She smiled confidently after getting the pontic tooth fitted.
meanings.sent3: The little girl joked that the pontic tooth was a secret spy in her mouth.
meanings.sent4: The pontic tooth felt like a tiny pearl in her smile.
meanings.sent5: The shiny pontic tooth completed her beautiful smile.
